description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.
guidance: Implement Conditional Access policies as the primary enforcement mechanism for logical access control. Define access tiers based on sensitivity (e.g., require compliant device + MFA for sensitive workloads). Use Azure AD groups and RBAC to assign access. Review access via Azure AD Access Reviews.

description: The full life cycle of identities shall be managed.
guidance: Use Azure AD as the authoritative identity provider. Automate provisioning and deprovisioning via HR-driven provisioning (Workday/SAP integrations) or SCIM. Remove stale accounts and disable unused identities. Use Azure AD entitlement management for access request workflows. Maps to Secure Score stale account and MFA controls.

description: Allocation and management of authentication information shall be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information.
guidance: Enable Azure AD Password Protection to ban weak and common passwords. Require phishing-resistant MFA (FIDO2, Windows Hello for Business) for privileged users. Eliminate password-only authentication paths. Use Microsoft Authenticator with number matching and additional context. Maps to Secure Score MFA and password controls.

description: Access rights to information and other associated assets shall be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.
guidance: Use Azure AD PIM for just-in-time privileged role activation with approval workflows and time-bound access. Conduct periodic access reviews via Azure AD Access Reviews to recertify role assignments and group memberships. Implement the principle of least privilege by using scoped admin roles instead of Global Admin. Maps to Secure Score PIM and admin role controls.

control_title: Information Security for Use of Cloud Services
description: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services shall be established in accordance with the organization's information security requirements.
guidance: Use Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps to discover, assess, and govern cloud service usage including shadow IT. Define sanctioned and unsanctioned app lists. Apply conditional access app control for real-time session monitoring of sensitive SaaS apps. Review OAuth app consents and revoke over-privileged third-party apps.

control_title: Assessment and Decision on Information Security Events
description: The organization shall be able to assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorized as information security incidents.
guidance: Use Microsoft Defender XDR for unified incident detection and triage across M365 workloads. Configure alert policies in the Microsoft 365 Defender portal for high-risk events. Use Microsoft Sentinel for advanced SIEM/SOAR correlation and automated incident classification. Enable Defender for Identity to detect identity-based attack patterns.

description: Information security incidents shall be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.
guidance: Enable automated investigation and response (AIR) in Microsoft Defender XDR to automatically contain and remediate threats. Configure response playbooks in Microsoft Sentinel. Use Defender for Endpoint to isolate compromised devices. Document and test incident response procedures. Maps to Secure Score Defender for Office 365 controls.

description: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.
guidance: Configure SharePoint and OneDrive versioning and recycle bin policies to enable recovery from ransomware or accidental deletion. Use Microsoft 365 Backup (where available) for point-in-time recovery. Document RTO/RPO requirements and test recovery procedures. Consider geo-redundant storage configuration in SharePoint.

description: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release.
guidance: Use Microsoft Purview retention policies and retention labels to enforce record-keeping requirements. Configure litigation hold for legally required preservation. Use records management with immutable records labels for regulatory compliance. Restrict access to compliance portal to designated roles. Maps to Secure Score data governance controls.

control_title: Information Security Awareness, Education and Training
description: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness, education and training and regular updates of the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.
guidance: Use Microsoft Defender for Office 365 Attack Simulation Training to run realistic phishing simulations and assign targeted training modules. Track completion rates and simulation results in the Microsoft 365 Defender portal. Configure auto-enrollment in training for users who fail simulations. Maps to Secure Score attack simulation training control.

description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.
guidance: Limit Global Admin assignments to fewer than 5 accounts and require they be cloud-only (no sync from on-premises). Enable Azure AD PIM for all privileged roles. Require MFA and approval for privileged role activation. Use emergency access accounts with strict monitoring. Maps to Secure Score admin MFA and PIM controls.

description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.
guidance: Require MFA for all users via Conditional Access. Prioritize phishing-resistant authenticators (FIDO2 security keys, Windows Hello for Business) for high-privilege accounts. Block legacy authentication protocols (IMAP, POP, SMTP Auth, basic auth) that bypass MFA. Disable security defaults only if Conditional Access is fully configured. This is the highest-impact Secure Score control.

description: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.
guidance: Enable Microsoft Defender Antivirus with cloud-delivered protection, real-time protection, and tamper protection on all endpoints via Intune. Enable Defender for Office 365 Safe Attachments and Safe Links. Configure attack surface reduction rules. Enable zero-hour auto-purge (ZAP) in Exchange Online. Maps to multiple Secure Score endpoint and email protection controls.

description: Information stored in information systems, devices or in any other storage media shall be deleted when no longer required.
guidance: Configure Microsoft Purview retention policies with deletion actions to enforce data lifecycle. Use auto-delete policies in Exchange, SharePoint, and Teams. Implement retention labels with disposition review for sensitive data classes. Configure inactive mailbox retention and deletion policies in Exchange Online.

description: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.
guidance: Use Microsoft Purview sensitivity labels to classify and protect sensitive data. Configure DLP policies to detect and block sharing of sensitive data types (PII, financial, health). Enable auto-labeling for known sensitive information types. Use sensitivity labels with encryption to restrict access to sensitive documents. Maps to Secure Score data classification controls.

description: Data leakage prevention measures shall be applied to systems, networks and any other devices that process, store or transmit sensitive information.
guidance: Deploy Microsoft Purview DLP policies across Exchange Online, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, and endpoints. Configure policies to detect sensitive information types and apply protective actions (block, notify, audit). Use Defender for Cloud Apps session policies to control file downloads in browser sessions. Enable endpoint DLP to prevent copying sensitive data to USB drives or unapproved cloud storage.

description: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected and analysed.
guidance: Enable Microsoft 365 Unified Audit Log with appropriate retention (90 days E3, 1 year E5 or compliance add-on). Enable mailbox auditing for all users. Configure Microsoft Purview audit to capture sensitive operations. Export logs to Microsoft Sentinel or immutable storage for long-term retention. Maps to Secure Score audit log controls.

description: Networks, systems and applications shall be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential information security incidents.
guidance: Enable Microsoft Entra ID Protection to detect risky sign-ins and users automatically. Configure Defender for Cloud Apps anomaly detection policies. Set up alert policies for high-risk activities. Use Microsoft Sentinel analytics rules for advanced threat detection. Enable Conditional Access risk-based policies to automatically require MFA step-up or block risky sessions.

description: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.
guidance: Use Conditional Access network location conditions and Named Locations to restrict access from untrusted networks. Consider Microsoft Entra Private Access (Global Secure Access) for zero-trust network access to corporate resources without VPN. Block legacy authentication that bypasses network controls. Use Exchange Online mail flow rules to control external email flow.

description: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.
guidance: Rely on Microsoft's service-side encryption for data at rest in Exchange Online, SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams (AES-256, enabled by default). Apply Microsoft Purview sensitivity labels with Azure Rights Management encryption for documents requiring user-specific access control. Use Customer Key (Microsoft 365 E5) to control root encryption keys. Enable TLS 1.2+ for all connections.
